text: this summer has seen a huge movement of

their journeys outside the EU all will

Budapest train station in Hungary has

that now has politicians across the

difference between the promises they're
making on what's happening on the ground
the UK has said it will take 500
refugees from Syria under its vulnerable
persons relocation scheme Germany has
officially said it will take 35,000
Syrians France an extra thousand Sweden

France more than 3000 Sweden
more than 26,000 Germany in particular

with a total of 800,000 assignment
claims expected in 2015 Chancellor

the most important thing is to try to

the numbers entering the EU are the
highest on record where the have been
peace not all that different in the past
in the late 90s the Kosovo conflict led

border and earlier in the decade the
same thing happened when war broke out

those cases the numbers claiming asylum
in the UK were in fact much greater than
today the figure peaked at 84 thousand
in 2002 amid instability in Iraq and the
fall of the Taliban in Afghanistan
back then it was Britain not Germany
taking in more refugees than anyone else
going back further still we granted
